name: KeyDetails
description: Returns private data on the key including remaining lookups, available datasets and usage limits.

ApiKeyParam.description:
Your API Key. Typically beings `ak_`.

Available from your dashboard
ApiKeyParam.title: API Key

UserTokenParam.description:
A secret key used for sensitive operations on your account and API Keys.

Your user token can be retrieved and managed from your [accounts page](https://ideal-postcodes.co.uk/account).

Typically beings `uk_...`
UserTokenParam.title: User Token

$ul: **code**
**message**
**result**
**allowed_urls**: A list of allowed URLs. An empty list means that allowed URLs are disabled.
**automated_topups**: Automated topup status
**enabled**: Indicates whether automated top-ups are enabled
**current_purchases**: Current balance purchases attached to key.
**daily_limit**
**consumed**: Number of lookups performed today which count towards your daily limit.
**limit**: `number` or `null`. The daily lookup limit currently set on your key.
**datasets**: Indicates which datasets are available and added by default to the address responses
**ecad**: IE Address File. Eircode Address Database
**ecaf**: IE Base Address File. Eircode Address File
**herewe**: Western Europe Address File
**mr**: UK Multiple Residence Dataset
**nyb**: UK Not Yet Built Dataset
**paf**: UK Main Address File (Postcode Address File)
**pafa**: UK Property Alias dataset
**pafw**: UK Welsh Language Dataset
**usps**: US Address Dataset
**individual_limit**
**limit**: `number` or `null` Limit set on the number of lookups that can be
**lookups_remaining**
**notifications**
**emails**: A list of email addresses designated by you to receive notifications about this key.
**enabled**: Indicates whether email notifications are enabled.
**code**: API Response Code. Non `2xxx` code indicates a failure. This code will provide a more specific reason when a failure occurs and facilitates debugging.
**message**: Human readable error message supplied with every error response.
**code**: API Response Code. Non `2xxx` code indicates a failure. This code will provide a more specific reason when a failure occurs and facilitates debugging.
**message**: Human readable error message supplied with every error response.
